Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town's Initial Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town and the initial conflicts arising from personal relationships and external threats.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Discord and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the romantic tension between the woman in the green hat (Nan) and the cowboy, culminating in the cowboy's frustrated departure from Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town and Initial Conflict

sub_scenes.title: The Airport Plan and Community Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the surveyors and their plan to build an airport, revealing the external threat to Ghost Town and the initial reactions of Nan and the cowboy.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival of Surveyors and the Airport Plan
Cowboy's Shock and the Impending Destruction of Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Misunderstanding and New Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene continues Nan and Cal's (Cowboy) relationship issues and introduces a new threatening encounter for Nan.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Romantic Misunderstanding and Parting
Nan's Reflection on Love and Past Hurt
Arrival of Rough Men and Discontent with 'Progress'

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation and Consolation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's attempts to engage with the town's affairs, her subsequent humiliation, and attempts to console her.

narrative_arcs.title: Businessmen Discuss Airport and Horses, Nan Interjects
Mother and Maid Console Nan About Cal

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Cal and Business Deal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's resolve to confront Cal and a brief return to the horse business subplot.

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Return and Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the unresolved conflict between Nan and Cal, leading to Cal's departure and unexpected return and confession.

Major_Arcs.title: The Harsh Winter and Community Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the focus to an external crisis—a severe winter storm—and its impact on the community and Nan and Cal's relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Turmoil and Winter's Onset
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene blends the ongoing emotional conversation between Nan and Cal with the introduction of the severe winter weather.

sub_scenes.title: Community Worry and Fleeting Comfort
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the community's growing anxiety about the snowstorm and a brief moment of domestic comfort.

sub_scenes.title: Escalation and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the worsening snowstorm and Cal's decisive reaction to address the crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Relief
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the community's despair, a glimmer of hope, and the eventual relief brought by the arrival of fodder.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane and Fodder

sub_scenes.title: Reflection on Romance Amidst Crisis Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the winter crisis arc by focusing on Nan and Cal's reflective conversation amidst the relief.

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Rising Tension
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the character of Chane Benson and the growing tensions related to Jeff's hero worship and potential violence.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Arrival and Town Reaction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic fight and shows varied reactions from the townspeople.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Unhealthy Hero Worship
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Jeff's unhealthy hero worship of his father and its concerning manifestations.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood Hero Worship
Justifying Actions with Clyde Surrett's Example
Dismissing Chane Benson and Embracing Violence

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Help and Clyde's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the woman's growing desperation and her plea to Clyde for help with Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Expressing Fear and Seeking Help from Clyde
Declaration of Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Reassurance and Promise of Shared Happiness

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Disappearance and Sally's Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks Jeff's disappearance and introduces Sally and Mr. Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Disappearance and Pursuit to Town
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Seeking Advice
Chane Benson's Menacing Demeanor and Disdain for Young Boys

sub_scenes.title: Conflict over Article and Benson's Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the fallout from the article about Chane Benson and the threats it provokes.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article and Benson's Threat
Warning about Benson's Cunning and Cowardice
Seeking Action from the Editor and Decision to Stay

sub_scenes.title: Strategic Discussions and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows strategic discussions and leads to the idea of inviting Benson to dinner.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Unwavering Resolve and Benson's Character
Shifting Opinions and Dinner Invitation Idea

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath of Dinner and Escalating Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the morning after the dinner and the rapid escalation of conflict between Jeff, Sally, and Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Fight, Warning, and Race to Rescue Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Clyde's Capture and Newspaper Action
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Clyde's capture and the subsequent actions at the Clarion office.

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Steve and Betsy and Ranch Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Steve Daley and Betsy and the conflicts arising at the Double B ranch.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Ranch Confrontation and Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the initial confrontation at the ranch and the introduction of Steve Daley.

sub_scenes.title: Bunk Assignment and Hank's Justification
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Steve's bunk assignment and Hank's justification for hiring Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Troubles and Buckboard Ride
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the ranch problems and depicts Betsy and Steve's buckboard ride into town.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bodyguard Role Confirmation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a town confrontation involving Betsy and Steve, leading to the confirmation of Steve as Betsy's bodyguard.

sub_scenes.title: Hank's Plea and Job Security
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Hank's plea to keep his job and Betsy's reassurance.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Job Secured and Gratitude Expressed

sub_scenes.title: Gun Stance and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy setting conditions for Steve's job and culminates in their romantic confessions and embrace.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification and Choice about Gunfighter Role
Betsy's Change of Heart and Plea to Stay

Major_Arcs.title: Bridges' Confrontation and Betsy's Strength
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the confrontation with Old Man Bridges and Betsy's strong and decisive actions.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Arrival and Escalating Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Bridges' arrival and the escalating confrontation with Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Analysis of the Confrontation as a Declaration of War

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Assertion and Past Tragedy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy asserting her authority and introduces the flashback of Hank's ambush.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Assertion of Authority and Gun Ownership
Steve's Reflection, Flashback to Ambush, and Hank's Fate

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Departure and Betsy's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Steve's determined departure and Betsy's decision to follow him.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Betsy's Shooting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in the confrontation at Devil's Pass and Betsy getting shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Recovery and Romantic Reunion at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's survival, her reunion with Steve, and their romantic resolution amidst the aftermath of the violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Survival and Reunion with Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Romantic Triangle and Ranch Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex romantic relationships between Carrie, Dave, and Fred and the ranch-related conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Conflicts and Curley's Actions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces initial conflicts involving Dave, Carrie, and Fred, and introduces the curious actions of Curley.

sub_scenes.title: Bar Fenin Ranch Conflict and Fence Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the conflict with Bar Fenin ranch buyers and escalates to a gunfight at the fence.

narrative_arcs.title: Trouble with Bar Fenin Ranch Buyers
Discussing the Fence and Range Issues
Fred Gordon's Confrontation at the Fence

sub_scenes.title: Apology, Intimacy, and Fred's Reappearance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Carrie and Dave's reconciliation, intimate conversation, and the ominous reappearance of Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Intimate Conversation and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Confession, and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie's confrontation with Fred, her private conversation with Dave, and the ensuing marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Past Misunderstandings and Romantic Resolution
Confrontation and Inquiry with Dave and Fred
Arrival and Interruption at Carlton's Office
Carlton's Business History and Carrie's Resolution
Declaration of Independence and Western Identity
Anger, Apology, and Question of Love
Father's Wisdom and Long Ride Home
Accusation of Heartbreak and Eastern Trickery
Reflection on Dave's Words and Embracing Love

sub_scenes.title: Dirk and Chris - Desperate Escape and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene begins the arc focused on Dirk and Chris's desperate escape and the relentless pursuit.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Search and Blood Stained Pinto

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Chris and Rance's romantic resolution amidst the ongoing pursuit of Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Violent Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the relentless chase and the violent confrontation between Rance and Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: Departure, Return, and Dirk's Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the difficult departure, Chris's return to Rance, and Dirk's successful escape to Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: The Difficult Departure and Lingering Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the Dirk storyline and focuses on Rance's recovery and the romantic resolution between Chris and Rance, culminating in their engagement.

narrative_arcs.title: Mutual Feelings and Confession of Love
Chris's Concern and Rance's Reassurance about Dirk
The Marshal's Appreciation and Wedding Gift
